title: What is the SC order on local polls in Maharashtra? | Explained
content: Why have elections not been held for several years? Has it affected governance? Who is running the show?

title: Sardar Patel Road to be widened at a cost of ₹45 crore
content: The work is to be taken up in two phases, with phase 1 running to a length of 1.70 km from IIT Madras to Raj Bhavan to be the first

title: Surprise checks across 23 locations net 312 drunk drivers in Hyderabad
content: Police officials said recent data show an increase in cases involving drivers consuming alcohol even during daylight hours

title: Mogalli Ganesh who saw Kannada folk through a desi lens passes away
content: Senior Kannada writer, critic, and folklore scholar Mogalli Ganesh passed away at his residence in Hosapete, Vijayanagara district

title: Haryana Congress leader Brijendra Singh embarks on Sadbhav Yatra” to revive social harmony against BJP’s divisive politics
content: Inspired by Rahul Gandhi’s Bharat Jodo Yatra, the yatra aims to carry forward the Congress’ vision and values directly to the people of Haryana and unify Congress workers and leaders

title: Mamata’s carnival push as north Bengal reels under floods gives Opposition a handle
content: Leaders from the BJP and CPI(M) raised question as to why the Chief Minister participated in the Durga Puja carnival on Sunday when north Bengal was reeling under floods. Ms. Banerjee will visit north Bengal on Monday

title: Reported sale of RD-93 engines to Pakistan will benefit India: Russian experts
content: “The new aircraft will be familiar and predictable to India, especially since they share the same engine and India observed the JF-17’s operational use during the May 2025 crisis”

title: Karnataka CM promises support for Foxconn’s expansion plans
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has promised Foxconn India necessary State government support for its expansion plans

title: List of 60 questions in Karnataka’s Social and Educational Survey a source of irritation to many
content: A list of 60 questions being posed as part of the Social and Educational Survey being conducted by the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes seems to be irritating those being enumerated, including politicians

title: Kochi leads in chargesheeting rate among metropolitan cities: NCRB
content: The city recorded a chargesheeting rate of 98.9% in 2023, continuing its impressive performance from 98% in 2022; as many as 67,616 cases were registered under both Indian Penal Code and Special and Local Laws, according to the data

title: Hyderabad logged over 9,000 road crashes in 2023
content: The 2023 NCRB report recorded 335 road accident deaths in Hyderabad; data shared by the police in the tri-commissionerate shows there were 1,779 deaths

title: R.N. Ravi, M.K. Stalin trade barbs over political slogan ‘Tamil Nadu Poradum, Tamil Nadu Vellum’
content: While the Governor hit out at the slogan during a function at the Raj Bhavan, the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu later responded through a social media post

title: Congress chooses enemy's side: BJP on Jairam Ramesh's dig over reports of Russian JF-17 engines to Pakistan
content: Russia’s decision to supply JF-17 jet engines to Pakistan a failure of PM’s personalised diplomacy, says Congress

title: Bihar polls | Nitish retains edge but undercurrents remain
content: The political landscape of Bihar reflects the rivers that define it. At first glance, the NDA alliance steered by Nitish appears as the Ganges’ main channel — broad and seemingly unstoppable. But in the deltas and backwaters, streams of dissent are forming and many voters are yet to choose which current to follow

title: Blanket ban on political events is unacceptable: Anbumani
content: He appeals to political parties to accept and comply with the reasonable conditions imposed by the government for the safe conduct of political meetings

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to visit Australia on October 9
content: The visit comes at a significant moment as India and Australia are marking five years of their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership

title: Shiv Sena leader Ramdas Kadam’s remarks on Bal Thackeray's death ‘disgusting’: Supriya Sule
content: The Shiv Sena leader’s comments have drawn sharp criticism from rival Shiv Sena (UBT) faction leaders, who called him “gaddar” (traitor) and “namak haram” (disloyal person)

title: Why is ADR crucial for India’s courts?
content: What is Alternative Dispute Resolution and how does it work in India? How long does it take to resolve disputes? What legal provisions support ADR and its processes? How can they reduce delays and court pendency effectively? Which States have the highest backlog of cases?

title: Supreme Court to hear plea raising question if military discipline overwhelms religious freedom in Armed Forces
content: The petition has been filed by a Christian Army officer who was issued order of termination from service for refusing to enter the sanctum sanctorum of the regiment’s temple to perform pooja

title: U.S. military beard ban: SAD chief Sukhbir Badal seeks Jaishankar's intervention
content: SAD chief said the U.S. government categorically acknowledged the right of the Sikh members of the U.S. armed forces to preserve their external symbols of religious identity, including turban and beard

title: India is ‘first responder’ to Nepal, assures PM Modi as flood hits Nepal
content: PM Modi assures immediate assistance as heavy rains cause loss of lives and damage infrastructure across the Himalayan nation

title: Cough syrup contamination: Health Ministry directs strict compliance with revised Schedule M norms
content: The Ministry has warned that licences of non-compliant units would be cancelled; the direction comes after an emergency meeting with all States and Union Territories on Sunday

title: Tandem cycle donation lets visually impaired person to join global inclusion fest
content: The project aims to empower visually impaired individuals by enhancing mobility, independence, and social inclusion, says president of Rotary Club of Bangalore Northwest

title: India-U.S. trade deal has to respect New Delhi’s ‘red lines’; efforts underway to address issues: Jaishankar
content: The External Affairs Minister said an understanding on trade between the two sides was necessary as the U.S. is the world’s largest market

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. agrees to fix in-service quota for PHC doctors in clinical branches at 20% this year
content: The doctors vow to continue the strike, insisting that the quota be fixed for five years as they cannot be expected to stage protest every year

title: GROUND REPORT: Inside Bengaluru’s citywide Social and Educational Survey
content: Enumerators say the public are refusing to cooperate. “Some are not even opening the door after seeing us. With this kind of cooperation, even completing three or four surveys is a big achievement,” they say.

title: New museum in Kollam celebrates A. Ramachandran’s works
content: Inaugurating the museum, Chief Minister says the painter’s art works are a link that connects contemporary Indian painting to its traditional past as well as its future

title: 36-hour curfew imposed in parts of Odisha’s Cuttack over communal tensions
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Majhi appeals for peace and harmony to preserve Cuttack’s unique brotherhood.

title: TDB denies using surplus fund for Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: Funds for the Sangamam were received entirely from sponsors, says TDB president P.S. Prasanth. Unspent amount will be credited to the Devaswom fund

title: Waiting for Thiruvonam bumper lottery winner
content: Speculations about the identity of the winner spread after the lottery agent who sold the ticket, said that it could be that of a woman residing in Nettoor

title: TDB Vigilance questions Potti for the second day over Sabarimala temple artefacts controversy
content: After a 4-hour questioning at at the TDB headquarters in Thiruvananthapuram, the priest who occasionally worked at Sabarimala says he is the victim of a media witch-hunt

title: Uproar as woman patient allegedly denied treatment due to her religion in U.P.’s Jaunpur
content: Opposition parties alleged that such instances are result of divisive politics and communalism practised by the ruling BJP

title: Puthenpally basilica marks 100 years of healing and hope
content: Centenary of the Basilica of Our Lady of Dolours celebrated with messages of faith, compassion, and service

title: Amit Shah hails ethanol programme as a game changer for sugar cooperatives
content: Union Minister credits ethanol blending for strengthening cooperatives, boosting rural prosperity, and promoting indigenous production

title: ‘Kalaburagi administration, public representatives have failed to provide proper flood relief’
content: There has been a persistent gap between government promises and ground reality, says Siddalinga Swami of Shiv Sena

title: Govt. to present Swachhata Awards in Andhra Pradesh on October 6
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to give away the awards to institutions, individuals, and government departments for achieving the objectives of Swachh Andhra

title: SCR Vijayawada division creates record transporting 5.5 lakh passengers on single day
content: Record breaking figures of passengers on a single day highlighted the trust and confidence of passengers in Indian Railways, says Divisional Railway Manager

title: Ernakulam Rural police’s anti-drug film screening for migrant workers draws packed audience
content: Nearly 200 migrant workers, labour suppliers, and social workers attended the screening of the Bengali film Pao the Drugs at EVM Theatre, Perumbavoor

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. plans to develop Srisailam temple on par with Tirumala
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs Endowments officials to prepare a comprehensive master plan that balances environmental protection with temple development; govt. to request Centre to allocate 2,000 hectares of forest land for the purpose

title: Harbaugh sticking with DC Orr after latest defeat
content: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said he's sticking with defensive coordinator Zach Orr following Sunday's 44-10 loss to the Texans, the latest defensive meltdown in a season that continues to spiral for Baltimore.

title: Panthers' Dowdle eyes Dallas after career game
content: After he rushed for 206 yards in the Panthers' comeback win, Rico Dowdle had a message for the Cowboys, Carolina's next opponent and his former team: "They got to buckle up."

title: Eagles pass game not on 'same page' in 1st loss
content: Eagles receiver DeVonta Smith said members of the passing game weren't "on the same page" at times during Sunday's 21-17 loss to the Broncos.

title: Bengals' Taylor planning 'to look at all personnel'
content: Bengals coach Zac Taylor sounded open to the possibility of a potential quarterback change after Jake Browning struggled again in a 37-24 loss to the Lions on Sunday.

title: 'Built for this': Yesavage, 22, shuts down Yankees
content: Rookie Trey Yesavage set a franchise-postseason record by striking out 11 in 5⅓ no-hit innings, Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit the first postseason grand slam in team history and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the New York Yankees 13-7 to take a 2-0 ALDS lead.

title: Pete Carroll processing Raiders' 1-4 start 'poorly'
content: Pete Carroll expected to win right away with the Raiders, but instead Las Vegas is 1-4, and the coach said he's processing that fact "poorly."

title: Dart takes the blame as turnovers derail Giants
content: After he turned the ball over three times Sunday, Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart said he told his teammates New York's loss was "on me."

title: Young delivers for Aces with 32 points in Game 2
content: Jackie Young finished with 32 points, including a WNBA Finals record 21 in the third quarter, to give the Aces a commanding 2-0 series lead over Phoenix.

title: Questions, takeaways off every NFL Week 5 game: Bucs and Titans win thrillers; is QB Browning done in Cincinnati?
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 5.

title: How shocking upsets and near misses of Week 6 impact conference, CFP races
content: How bleak are things for Penn State and Texas? What's next in the ACC and Big 12? Bill Connelly has answers.

title: Miami dominance and a UCLA stunner: Recapping a chaotic Week 6
content: In Week 6, the Grim Reaper came for Penn State and Texas, but Miami proved itself against Florida State.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What to make of Nico Iamaleava, Carson Beck in this QB class
content: Does Nico Iamaleava fit into the 2026 class? Could Miami stack first-rounders? We have updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 6.

title: Ranking Week 5 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 5's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Bills' 'Cold Front' Rivalry uniforms top Week 5 threads
content: It's a busy uniform slate in Week 5 of the NFL season, led by Buffalo   debuting its Rivalry threads.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Singapore shows McLaren's management of title rivals will only get harder
content: Another flash point between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri showed McLaren's ordeal in managing its drivers.

title: After regaining the light heavyweight belt at UFC 320, Alex Pereira should move to heavyweight
content: Now that Pereira is a champ again, the UFC should give the fans the heavyweight blockbuster they want.

title: Marner in Vegas, Sullivan in New York and Crosby ... on the move? Guide to the NHL season
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: Two-sport takeover: No. 1 hoops prospect Tyran Stokes scores on turf, stars on hardwood
content: The 6-7, 230-pound Notre Dame (CA) star scored in his football debut before taking the hardwood in the Border League at 9 p.m. ET on ESPN2.

title: College football recruiting intel: Could we see big flips? Which classes could rise?
content: Are Florida recruits wavering? Could we see some five-star flips? We look at where the classes and top prospects stand.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: 📈 Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: 🩺 Tyreek Hill injury timeline, impact on Fins
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: 👊 MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: 🏆 Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: ⛳ Ryder envelope rule must change, Bradley says
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: 🗣️ Players support Collier in ripping WNBA
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: 💰 Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Colts CB Howard abruptly retires
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Barcelona keeper Ter Stegen
content: Manchester United are among the Premier League clubs eyeing Barcelona goalkeeper Marc-André ter Stegen. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Eight arrested for hailing rowdies on social media
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Two held with MDMA worth ₹10 lakh
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Rajasthan: 6 dead, 5 critical after fire breaks out at ICU ward of hospital; what triggered the blaze?
content: Six patients died and five remain critical after a short circuit caused a fire at Jaipur’s SMS Hospital trauma ICU on Sunday night. The blaze quickly spread, releasing toxic gases, leading to the evacuation of 24 patients by staff. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Cuttack violence: Curfew, internet ban for 36 hrs; CM Majhi appeals for peace
content: Cuttack city faces curfew and internet suspension after fresh violence erupted during Durga idol immersion, injuring police and civilians. Chief Minister Majhi appealed for calm, promising strict action against miscreants. Authorities imposed a 36-hour curfew and internet ban following a stone-pelting bike rally that injured 25. Tensions remain high as VHP calls for a bandh.

title: Israel-Gaza peace deal: Trump urges all sides to ‘move fast’; warns of ‘massive bloodshed’
content: US President Trump urges swift action on his Israel-Gaza peace initiative, reporting "very positive discussions" with Hamas and other nations for hostage release and ending the war. He warns of "massive bloodshed" if his plan, involving a ceasefire and Hamas disarmament, isn't quickly finalized. Technical teams will meet Monday to clarify details.

title: Bengal floods: 28 dead, dozens missing as rain ravages Darjeeling hills
content: Heavy overnight rain caused landslides and flooding in North Bengal. At least 28 people died, mostly in Mirik. Bridges collapsed, isolating towns and stranding tourists. Rescue operations are ongoing in affected areas. The Chief Minister announced immediate assistance. Rivers are flowing above danger levels. Animals fled submerged forests.

title: Ex-England captain slams IND-PAK scheduling: 'Proxy for propaganda'
content: Former England captain Michael Atherton has urged the ICC to increase transparency in tournament draws and reduce India-Pakistan matches. His call follows political controversies during the 2025 Asia Cup, where the consistent grouping of these teams is driven by significant economic interests. Atherton argues this commercial exploitation is unjustified, advocating for transparent draws regardless of match frequency.

title: Copilot ‘confusion’: Microsoft CEO offers fix; Response leaves employees laughing
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella recently addressed employee concerns. He spoke about multiple Copilot products. Nadella suggested daily usage would resolve customer confusion. An employee highlighted two mobile Copilot apps. Microsoft aims to clarify its marketing strategy. The company reports 100 million monthly active Copilot users. Leaders are coordinating product promotion.

title: Fire engulfs US judge’s beachfront house; video shows towering plumes of smoke
content: A massive blaze gutted Judge Diane Goodstein's beachfront home, hospitalizing her ex-senator husband, Arnold Goodstein, and two others after an "apparent explosion." Arnold sustained serious injuries jumping from the burning building. Authorities are investigating the fire, which occurred amidst recent death threats against Goodstein following a controversial court ruling.

title: IND vs PAK: Run-out controversy! Pakistan camp breaks silence
content: Pakistan's Diana Baig confirmed resolution of Muneeba Ali's controversial run-out against India in the Women's World Cup. The incident saw Muneeba initially declared not out for LBW, then run out after lifting her bat, amidst conflicting umpire decisions. This crucial dismissal significantly impacted Pakistan's chase, contributing to their 88-run loss and intensifying the India-Pakistan rivalry.

title: Coldrif tragedy: Doctor held, SIT set up as Madhya Pradesh's 'syrup toll' rises to 14
content: Madhya Pradesh's cough syrup tragedy deepened as three more children died in Chhindwara, raising the toll to 14. A doctor was arrested for prescribing Coldrif, now banned after diethylene glycol was confirmed. An SIT is formed, and a child's body exhumed for autopsy. The manufacturer is also booked as eight children remain hospitalized, highlighting a grave public health crisis.

title: Jeff Bezos makes a rare public appearance; says 'millions of people will live in space'
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos predicted millions will live in space within decades, driven by personal choice, with robots handling labor. He also envisioned gigawatt-scale AI data centers in orbit within 10-20 years, leveraging 24/7 solar power to outperform Earth-based facilities. Bezos called the AI investment surge a "good industrial bubble," expressing bullish optimism for the future.

title: Virat, Rohit get fresh warning: 'They want to play 2027 WC but'
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has advised Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to play domestic cricket to maintain game fitness for the 2027 ODI World Cup, citing their reduced international schedule. This comes as Shubman Gill takes over as India's new ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, and will also lead in Tests.

title: ‘I’ll stay in jail till there’s justice’: Wangchuk’s message from behind bars
content: Jailed climate activist Sonam Wangchuk demands a judicial inquiry into the Leh firing. Four people died and over 70 were wounded in the September 24 incident. Wangchuk remains in prison under NSA. He supports Ladakh's fight for statehood and Sixth Schedule status. Talks with the government are stalled until an inquiry happens. His wife challenges his arrest in Supreme Court.

title: India-EU ties: FTA talks today will seek to resolve key issues
content: Ahead of the 14th India-EU FTA talks, the EU highlighted challenging but crucial negotiations for a mutually beneficial deal. Despite no breakthrough in the last round, both sides are committed to resolving differences, aiming to unlock significant bilateral trade and investment potential, including an Investment Protection Agreement.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
content: SpaceX secured five of seven critical US Space Force military launch missions for the upcoming fiscal year, totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space contracts. United Launch Alliance received the remaining two missions. Blue Origin's New Glenn remains uncertified, missing out on this cycle's awards, though a NASA Mars mission could advance its prospects.

title: Why are the Buffalo Bills wearing their all-white ‘Cold Front’ uniforms?
content: The Buffalo Bills debuted their new "Cold Front" uniforms on Sunday Night Football, transforming Highmark Stadium into a white spectacle. Part of the NFL's Rivalries series, these icy white-on-white designs with frosted silver details celebrate Buffalo's unique winter identity and resilience. This debut marks a special season as the team embraces its heritage.

title: IND vs PAK: Pathan trolls Pakistan without naming them - ‘Just another Sunday’
content: India's women's team secured an 88-run victory over arch-rivals Pakistan in the ODI World Cup, marking their fourth consecutive Sunday win against them. The tense match saw no post-game handshake and pre-match controversy, yet India remained composed to top the table. Harleen Deol and Richa Ghosh starred with the bat, while spinners dominated.

title: Karnataka: Lingayat is a separate religion, says CM Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah controversially declared Lingayat a separate religion, reigniting past allegations of community division. This statement comes amidst internal Lingayat confusion over identifying as a distinct religion or Hindu caste in ongoing surveys. While BJP urges Hindu caste identification, Congress promotes separate religious status.

title: Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones’ love story: From dance fever to 30 years of marriage
content: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6'9" Matt Rempe, refuses to flinch
content: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: IND vs PAK: After beating Pakistan, captain sends message to Indians - 'I'm sure'
content: India secured a commanding 88-run victory over Pakistan in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025, extending their unbeaten record to 12-0. Batting first, India posted 247, with Harleen Deol and Richa Ghosh contributing crucial runs. Pakistan was subsequently bowled out for 159, despite Sidra Amin's fighting 81, as Kranti Goud and Deepti Sharma led India's effective bowling attack.

title: Interval walking: 3-minute Japanese technique offers better results than jogging
content: Japanese researchers have unveiled an "Interval Walking Training" method, potentially burning more fat than jogging. This technique involves alternating three minutes of brisk walking with three minutes of slow walking for 30 minutes. This technique activates aerobic and anaerobic systems, triggers excess post exercise oxygen consumption and stimulates mitochondrial activity.

title: Bihar polls: CEC says rolls ‘purified’ but stays mum on ‘infiltrators’
content: The Election Commission announced 17 new initiatives for Bihar's upcoming assembly elections, slated for national replication. CEC Gyanesh Kumar declared electoral rolls "purified" after 22 years through a Special Intensive Revision, dismissing opposition charges. Over 68 lakh ineligible voters were removed.

title: India-US trade talks: New Delhi's 'red lines' must be respected, says Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar acknowledged "problems" in India-US trade relations, emphasizing India's non-negotiable "red lines" on farmers' interests. He called US tariffs, partly due to Russian oil purchases, "unfair." Despite trade hurdles, Jaishankar affirmed other aspects of the relationship and the Quad remain strong.

title: Women's World Cup: It's 12-0 now! India thrash Pakistan by 88 runs
content: India secured a commanding 88-run victory over Pakistan in the ICC Women’s World Cup. Harleen Deol’s steady 46 and Richa Ghosh’s explosive 35* powered India to 247, while Kranti Gaud's 3/20 spearheaded a disciplined bowling effort. This win extended India's perfect ODI record against Pakistan, despite Sidra Amin's valiant 81.

title: Uttar Pradesh: 'Shoot on sight' orders for wolves in Bahraich
content: Uttar Pradesh's forest department issued "shoot on sight" orders for aggressive wolves in Bahraich district following six deaths and recent injuries. While fresh attacks occurred, one animal killed by villagers was identified as a jackal, not a wolf, adding confusion. Authorities are taking measures to neutralize threats, and a state minister has pledged aid to affected families.

title: West Bengal: Flood waters wash away rhinos, trap jumbos near Gorumara, Jaldapara
content: Heavy rains have severely impacted North Bengal's forest areas and wildlife, causing widespread flooding in national parks like Jaldapara and Gorumara. Forest infrastructure is severely hit, with reports of one rhino death and six rhinos washed away. Several elephants are also stranded.

title: Lakers vs Warriors preseason: Prediction, odds, spread, and best prop bets
content: The Los Angeles Lakers and Golden State Warriors will clash in a highly anticipated preseason game on October 6, 2025, at the Chase Center. This showdown previews the fierce 2025-26 NBA season, with the Warriors slightly favored on their home court. Both teams, boasting star power like LeBron James and Luka Doncic, promise a thrilling contest.

title: Coldrif row: 14 MP kids given cough syrup fighting for life in Maharashtra hospitals
content: Fourteen children from Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district are critically ill in Nagpur hospitals after consuming the banned Coldrif cough syrup, which caused renal failure. Six earlier deaths at GMCH-Nagpur were confirmed due to diethylene glycol (DEG) toxicity from the contaminated syrup. Maharashtra has banned Coldrif, and Nagpur authorities are advising against prescribing cough syrups to young children.

title: Rajasthan high court: Drop 'Maharaj' from petition or case will fall
content: Rajasthan High Court has directed descendants of the former Jaipur royal family to remove "Maharaj" and "Princess" prefixes from their ongoing legal petitions. Justice Mahendra Kumar Goyal set an October 13 deadline, warning that non-compliance would lead to the dismissal of their 24-year-old case.

title: Travis Kelce faces Golden Globes snub as Taylor Swift drops Life of a Showgirl
content: Travis Kelce's podcast, New Heights, surprisingly missed out on the inaugural Golden Globes Best Podcast Award nominations. This snub occurred as his fiancée, Taylor Swift, launched her new album, "Life of a Showgirl," which features lyrics directly referencing their engagement and his podcast. Despite the podcast's massive growth and celebrity guests, its exclusion created a bittersweet day for Kelce.

title: Karur Stampede: After Madras high court rap, rash driving FIR slapped on Vijay's driver
content: Tamil Nadu police charged actor-politician Vijay's bus driver for negligent driving. This action followed a Madras High Court query regarding unfiled FIRs for alleged hit-and-run incidents during a Karur stampede. The September 27 event killed 41 people. A police SIT now probes overcrowding and security lapses. The stampede sparked a political row, with parties blaming each other.

title: Russell Wilson trade rumours: Giants QB’s future uncertain after Week 4 benching
content: Russell Wilson's New York Giants tenure faces uncertainty after his benching for rookie Jaxson Dart. Following fan backlash and a dismal team record, NFL insider Jonathan Jones suggests Wilson could be traded for a Day 3 pick, with his new team owing only a prorated salary.

title: Cough syrup tragedy: Govt urges states, UTs to strictly comply with revised drug norms
content: Union health secretary Punya Salila Srivastava urged states to enforce strict GMP compliance after child deaths in MP linked to substandard cough syrup. An investigation found 'Coldrif' cough syrup contained excessive Diethylene Glycol, leading to recommended license cancellation and criminal proceedings against the manufacturer. Officials also advised rational use of cough syrups for children.

title: India and Australia to ink three defence agreements during Rajnath Singh’s visit
content: India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will visit Australia to sign three agreements enhancing bilateral defence cooperation in information sharing, maritime security, and joint military activities. This visit marks five years of their comprehensive strategic partnership, with upcoming joint exercises and a shared commitment to a free Indo-Pacific, eyeing China's expansion.

title: ‘Met terrorists four times’: Aide arrested in Pahalgam attack provided logistics
content: Mohammad Yousuf Katari was arrested for his role in the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, providing logistical support like an Android phone charger and guiding the terrorists. Officials tracked the partially destroyed charger, recovered after the terrorists were killed, leading to his capture. His interrogation is expected to uncover further links in the terror support network.

title: Emergency buy: Army to get 6 AK-630s systems
content: The Indian Army is fast-tracking the acquisition of six mobile AK-630 multi-barrel air defence gun systems to protect border population centres from hostile drones, rockets, and mortars. These 30mm guns, with a 4-6 km range and high rate of fire, will integrate into the Akashteer network.

title: No guarantee you will return: US rejects Indian student's visa plea, cites no strong tie to home country
content: Indian student Kaushik Raj received a US visa rejection, despite a $100,000 Columbia scholarship, due to officials' belief he lacked sufficient ties to India. The rejection letter said that an applicant has to demonstrate that they have a residence in a foreign country which they have no intention of abandoning.

title: India, UK kick off high-voltage 'Konkan' naval exercise in Indian Ocean
content: India and the UK commenced their major `Konkan` naval exercise in the western Indian Ocean, deploying aircraft carriers, warships, and fighters. Led by INS Vikrant and HMS Prince of Wales, the biennial drills aim to enhance interoperability and reinforce a free and open Indo-Pacific, ahead of British PM Keir Starmer’s visit. This exercise strengthens strategic ties and regional maritime stability.

title: ‘Chicago is a war zone’: Trump admin declares US cities as battle field
content: The Trump administration deployed federal troops to Chicago, labeling it a "war zone," despite strong opposition from local leaders. This move, part of a broader federal intervention in Democrat-run cities, faced legal hurdles in Portland where a court blocked deployment. Public opinion is divided, yet the White House signals no retreat from its controversial strategy.

title: Hartenstein’s wife Kourtney steps back from glam life for heartfelt reason
content: Kourtney Hartenstein steps down as a ring girl after five years. She now dedicates her time to family, supporting NBA champion husband Isaiah Hartenstein and their young son. Hartenstein plans to attend Oklahoma City Thunder games this season. She also explores new work opportunities, including a family foundation. This marks a new chapter for her.

title: Jon Jones thanks Alex Pereira for dedicating UFC 320 win to late brother
content: Alex Pereira reclaimed the UFC light heavyweight title at UFC 320, defeating Magomed Ankalaev by TKO. In a poignant moment, Pereira dedicated his victory to Arthur Jones, the recently deceased brother of Jon Jones, who was a former NFL player. This heartfelt tribute resonated deeply, overshadowing the championship win itself.

title: Insider: Oilers owner Daryl Katz’s impatience clouds McDavid’s future
content: Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid's contract uncertainty is causing significant unease within the franchise as he enters his final year. Owner Daryl Katz is reportedly "antsy" over the delay, despite no animosity. NHL insider Darren Dreger suggests a 50-50 chance of an extension, possibly a short-term deal, leaving the team's future in McDavid's hands.

title: Pak bowler gives 'death stare'; Harmanpreet's reaction goes viral - watch
content: India secured an 88-run victory over Pakistan in the ICC Women’s World Cup, posting a competitive total of 247. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur displayed remarkable composure under pressure during a fiery exchange with Nashra Sandhu. India's disciplined bowling then ensured Pakistan was bowled out for 159, highlighting their dominance and Kaur's leadership.

title: "Massive Bloodshed Will Follow": Trump Warns Israel, Hamas On Gaza Plan
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday urged Israel and Hamas to "move fast" on the Gaza peace plan, warning that failure to do so may lead to "massive bloodshed".

title: "Had Come Down For Dinner": Man Who Lost Mother In Jaipur Hospital Fire
content: Eight patients have died in a fire at Rajasthan's biggest government hospital, Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Hospital in Jaipur. A short circuit is said to be the cause of the fire, which engulfed the ICU where 11 patients were being treated.

title: 8 Patients Dead In Jaipur Hospital Fire, Families Allege Staff Ignored Warnings
content: Eight critical patients were killed in a fire at the trauma centre of the state-run Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Hospital in Jaipur late Sunday night, officials stated.

title: 20 Injured As Gunman Opens Fire On Sydney Street From Restaurant Rooftop
content: A man is in custody after allegedly shooting up to a hundred bullets into a busy Sydney street, wounding twenty people, with police on Monday ruling out links to terrorism or gang activity.

title: Team Trump Brands These US Cities As "War Zones"
content: The Trump administration branded Chicago a "war zone" Sunday as a justification for deploying soldiers against the will of local Democratic officials, while a judge blocked the White House from sending troops to another Democratic-run city.

title: "We're Dealing With Killers, Savages, Terrorists": US Secretary On Hamas
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Sunday (local time) lauded the coalition of the Arab nations strung together by US President Donald Trump for ending the Gaza conflict.

title: Delhi Government Offices To Remain Closed On Valmiki Jayanti On Tuesday
content: All Delhi government offices will remain closed on October 7 on the occasion of Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti, an official statement said on Sunday.

title: Hamas Calls For Swift Hostage-Prisoner Swap Ahead Of Peace Talks In Egypt
content: Hamas on Sunday called for a swift start to a hostage-prisoner exchange with Israel, as negotiators from both sides headed to Egypt for crucial talks aimed at ending the nearly two-year war in Gaza.

title: Navy To Commission 'Androth', Second Anti-Submarine Warfare Ship Today
content: The Indian Navy will commission 'Androth', the second Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Craft (ASW-SWC), at the Naval Dockyard here on October 6.

title: Manipur Ambush May Have Been "Contract Killing" To Undermine President's Rule: Report
content: Security forces have launched a major crackdown on the banned People's Liberation Army (PLA), a Manipur valley-based insurgent group, arresting a total of 15 including two key suspects directly involved in last month's ambush on Assam Rifles.

title: Telangana's Quota Issue In Supreme Court, State Plans Strategy Session
content: Telangana Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka, Congress's state unit chief Mahesh Kumar Goud, and minister Ponnam Prabhakar are expected to travel to New Delhi soon to meet the legal counsel representing the state in Supreme Court.

title: Syria Selects Members Of First Post-Assad Parliament
content: Local committees in Syria cast their ballots for members of a transitional parliament in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of the new lawmakers to be appointed directly by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa.

title: "It Will Last A Couple Of Days": Trump On Gaza Deal Talks
content: President Donald Trump on Sunday said talks on implementing a truce for Gaza will take days, while his foreign policy chief Marco Rubio warned that Israel needs to stop bombing for a hostage release to happen.

title: Trump Administration Declares Chicago "War Zone" After Deploying Soldiers
content: The Trump administration branded Chicago a "war zone" Sunday as a justification for deploying soldiers against the will of local Democratic officials.

title: France Unveils New Government Amid Political Deadlock
content: French President Emmanuel Macron named a new government on Sunday, putting together a team under Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu as he struggles to pull the country out of a political crisis.

title: Cough Syrup, Then More Sickness And Death: Shell-Shocked Families Try To Cope
content: After days of denial, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Dr. Mohan Yadav has announced Rs 4 lakh compensation for each of the 11 children who died after consuming Coldrif Cough Syrup.

title: Political Row Begins Over Delay In Maharashtra Flood Relief
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who is in Maharashtra's Ahilyanagar for a series of cooperative sector events, assured that the Centre will not delay assistance to flood-affected farmers once the state government submits its report.

title: Video: Noida Residents Rattled After Cobra Takes Elevator Ride
content: It was not quite the kind of passenger anyone expected in the lift of a high-rise society in Noida, but there it was, a cobra, hood flared, writhing on the floor.

title: 5 Killed, 5 Injured As SUV Collides With Truck In Chhattisgarh
content: Five persons, including three women and a minor girl, were killed and five others were injured, two of them critically, on Sunday when the SUV carrying them collided with a truck in Kabirdham district of Chhattisgarh, police said.

title: Internet Banned, 36-Hour Curfew In Odisha's Cuttack After Clashes
content: Odisha's Cuttack, the thousand-year-old city long celebrated for its communal harmony, remained on edge on Sunday after fresh incidents of violence erupted following clashes during Durga Puja idol immersion two days earlier.

title: Archaeologist Daniel Jones? Colts QB embracing 'Indiana Jones' nickname
content: the Indianapolis Colts announced the signing of quarterback Daniel Jones on X in march . they captioned their post simply: "INDIANA JONES" that planted the seeds of a new nickname that has taken the NFL by storm . references to Jones as the fictional hero professor and archaeologist received near universal acclaim .

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more
content: last season, there were plenty of opportunities for regression, given what occurred during the 2023-24 season . candidates for regression include those most likely to see a 10+% drop in production, whether it's goals or points, based on their situations .

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: Best of NFL Week 5's arrivals, featuring Stefon Diggs
content: players treated arrival like fashion week -- sharp tailoring, patterns, mixed textures and a few fits that demanded a second glance . a handful of fits pushed into fashion-forward territory -- wide-leg trousers, fine details, unexpected proportions -- and drew cameras long before warmups .

title: 🏈 Projecting CFP top 12: Who's the No. 1 team?
content: the canes have the best combination of eye test and résumé, wtc . the u isn't just back, so is its swagger . it's the latest projection of what the group's top 12 would look like .

title: Rollins creates more animosity with Cody, Orton
content: seth Rollins continues to question himself and be fueled by his desire for revenge and validation . the vision def. cody Rhodes and Randy Orton defeated Rhodes . a stomp on Orton was an interesting end because it adds another layer of animosity .

title: Takeaways: Pereira, Merab among the best fighters in the world
content: merab Dvalishvili won his third men's bantamweight title defense against Cory Sandhagen . the former light heavyweight champion has regained the throne again . pereira needed less than 90 seconds to overwhelm Magomed Ankalaev .

title: AP Week 6 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the latest AP poll is out. most ranked teams held steady . the Ohio State Buckeyes stayed atop the poll after a convincing win over the Minnesota Golden Gophers . but both the no. 7 Penn State Nittany Lions and then no. 9 Texas Longhorns were stunned by unranked opponents .

title: Your guide to the Aces going up 2-0 against the Mercury in the 2025 WNBA Finals
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 91-78 in Game 2 of the 2025 WNBA Finals . Jackie Young had 32 points while four-time MVP A'ja Wilson had 28 points and 14 rebounds . despite a quiet scoring performance, Alyssa Thomas passed Courtney Vandersloot to become the all-time leader in postseason assists .

title: How to bet the 'Big Three' national title contenders
content: six weeks into college football season, the chaos is starting to settle . the big three for me are Ohio State , Oregon and Miami . this conversation isn't about rankings or résumés: it's about readiness and who is built to survive playoff games .
